Training & Orientation

We get it—starting a new job is stressful. That’s why all of us at Dot Transportation, Inc. (DTI) believe our training and orientation program is one of the best in the industry. We want to make you feel as comfortable as possible when taking the next step in your career. 

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://drivefordot.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/47169565182_4819ccde94_o.jpg” _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_margin=”-54px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#0065a4″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://drivefordot.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/HPHero11.jpg” alt=”Dot Transportation Truck Driver” title_text=”Dot Transportation Truck Driver” admin_label=”Apply Now Image Vertical” _builder_version=”4.10.5″ _module_preset=”default” global_module=”34005″ saved_tabs=”all” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text admin_label=”Apply Now Title Vertical” _builder_version=”4.10.6″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#0C71C3″ header_3_font=”|700|||||||” header_3_text_color=”#FFFFFF” header_3_font_size=”30px” custom_padding=”|25px||25px|false|true” global_module=”34006″ saved_tabs=”all” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Interested in Joining Our Team?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_button button_url=”https://intelliapp.driverapponline.com/c/dotfoods?r=drivefordot” url_new_window=”on” button_text=”Apply Now” button_alignment=”center” admin_label=”Apply Now Button Vertical” _builder_version=”4.10.5″ _module_preset=”default” custom_button=”on” button_text_size=”16px” button_use_icon=”off” custom_margin=”-23px||||false|false” custom_padding=”|25px||25px|false|true” global_module=”34007″ saved_tabs=”all” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_button][et_pb_text admin_label=”Apply Now Short Form Vertical” _builder_version=”4.10.5″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#FFFFFF” link_text_color=”#FFFFFF” custom_padding=”|25px|55px|25px|false|true” global_module=”34002″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Need More Information Before You Apply? We’d love to talk to you. »

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.16″ background_color=”#0063a4″ custom_padding=”||0px|||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” width=”100%” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_cta title=”The sooner you apply to drive with Dot, the sooner you get to hit the road as one of the safest drivers in the industry!” button_url=”https://intelliapp.driverapponline.com/c/dotfoods?r=drivefordot” url_new_window=”on” button_text=”Discover the Next Step” _builder_version=”4.16″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” min_height=”291px” custom_padding=”|20px|0px|20px||” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_cta][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”2_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”||||||||” header_2_font_size=”25px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

What to Expect When Training at DTI

At DTI, our goal is to make you feel confident and safe on the road. Because we want you to succeed, we have a training program that every driver goes through.

Dot has a business model that many drivers haven’t seen before, and a lot of processes and policies that must be thoroughly explained. That means the training you are put through may be on the longer side when you compare it to industry norms.

The length of the training will depend on your past experience and will continue until you are safe and comfortable behind the wheel of a Dot truck. That being said, after your training and orientation is done, you will be ready to hit the road with all of your new Dot knowledge. 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://drivefordot.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/truck.png” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_margin=”-17%||” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Dot training and orientation takes 3-10 weeks depending on your experience

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”||||||||” header_2_font_size=”25px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Driver Training & Orientation Schedule

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color=”#333333″ open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” icon_color=”#0c71c3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ toggle_text_color=”#333″ toggle_font=”|700|||||||” body_font=”||||||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Week 1: Classroom Orientation ” open=”on” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

Your first week at DTI will be spent in an in-house classroom-style orientation. During this orientation, you will become familiar with Dot’s brand, business model, supply chain model, and more. 

Orientation includes a wide variety of modules and lessons. A few of those modules include:

  • O.S.H.A. training
  • Emergency Action Plan
  • How driver pay works at Dot
  • Company and driver programs, such as 401(k), tuition reimbursement; shirt, jacket, and boot programs; passenger program, and more. 
  • Dot history and economics
  • Trip planning and delivery paperwork
  • Injury prevention
  • Material handling and forklift training
  • Truck information and equipment
  • Food safety and security 
  • Smith System 5 Keys

We know that list can seem long and overwhelming. But our goal is that all of the information you learn will become second nature once you are out on the road.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Week 2: On the Road” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Training is what takes up the majority of your first three to 10 weeks as a Dot driver. Because everyone learns and adapts at a different speed, we do not state a specific number of weeks for our training program and leave it as a range of time instead. 

During those weeks of training, you will be accompanied by a trainer. While this may seem similar to other companies’ training programs, DTI is different. Because we want you to develop your skills, you are accompanied by a trainer, but you do not team drive with a trainer. Your trainer will be in the passenger seat the entire time. 

Our training program is very hands-on. After that week on the road, the driver trainee will start taking more initiative while our trainers are primarily there to supervise, shadow, and coach.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Week 3: Classroom Orientation” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

After being on the road for a week and putting your new Dot knowledge to work, our trainees will go back to the classroom to continue to tackle the wide variety of modules and lessons.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Week 4+: Back on the Road” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

For the remaining weeks of training, you will be back on the road with a driver trainer until you and your trainer feel that you are going to be safe and comfortable going solo on the road.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”The Final Test” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Before you are allowed to take a DTI truck out on the road on your own, you will have to complete a final test. Your trainer also has to feel that you and everyone driving near you would be safe on the road. But, once your trainer gives you the “green light” and you pass your test, you will be ready to be a solo Dot driver!

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title=”Hitting the Road Solo” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}” open=”off”]

Congratulations! Once you have completed your three to 10 weeks of orientation and are set to begin your next adventure as a Dot driver.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”||||||||” header_2_font_size=”25px” header_3_font=”||||||||” header_3_font_size=”20px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Getting Paid During Training & Orientation

We understand that you need to continue paying your bills and managing your finances while you are going through training—so we make sure we pay our drivers while they are training on the road with us. 

Students & Inexperienced Drivers

Have you just completed driving school? Or have been driving with your CDL A for less than 200,000 miles? Here’s what you’ll receive:

  • $750 per week during training
  • Free lunch while in the classroom
  • Daily budget for food costs while training on the road

Experienced Drivers

Do you have 200,000 miles or more under your belt? Experienced drivers can expect the following:

  • $1,250 per week during training
  • Free lunch while in the classroom
  • Daily budget for food costs while training on the road

We know training isn’t anyone’s favorite part of a new job—but our goal is always to make sure you feel prepared to uphold Dot’s standards and brand promise, and you feel safe while behind the wheel of one of our 1,300+ trucks.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Future Drivers

Looking to earn your CDL and become a professional driver? DTI will pay for your driving school tuition and, in many cases, give you a weekly paycheck to boot! Visit our driving schools page to learn more and find a participating facility near you.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”CTA” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_color=”#0063a4″ background_position=”top_center” custom_padding=”||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.16″ width=”100%” min_height=”186px” custom_padding=”27px|||||” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_cta title=”Want to learn more about what it takes to be a Dot driver?” button_url=”/contact” button_text=”Talk To A Recruiter” _builder_version=”4.16″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_color=”#ffffff” background_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” custom_padding=”|20px||20px” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_cta][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_class=”site-footer” _builder_version=”4.10.8″ background_color=”#f0efef” min_height=”473px” custom_padding=”35px||35px||false|false” global_module=”28068″ saved_tabs=”all” collapsed=”off” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”2_5,3_5″ make_equal=”on” module_class=”drivefordotfooter” _builder_version=”4.16″ width_tablet=”80%” width_phone=”” width_last_edited=”on|desktop” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”2_5″ _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://drivefordot.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/DOT_Blue_adv_website.png” _builder_version=”4.16″ width=”20%” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text admin_label=”Text” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_text_color=”#000000″ text_line_height=”1em” header_2_font_size=”28px” min_height=”195px” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”||-2%” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

meta._et_pb_old_content: Dot Transportation has one of the best training programs in the industry. As a new DTI driver, we don’t just throw you out on the road. All newly hired drivers spend their first week in the classroom learning the new role they will be expected to perform. If you are just out of driving school, you’ll spend six to eight weeks driving with one of our senior DTI trainers until you have a thorough understanding of the job. While in training, new drivers earn $750 a week, plus meals.  Drivers with over 200,000 miles of confirmed experience are compensated $1,250 per week of orientation and training.
